image.altText: A graphic showing a girl sitting in the dock of a courtroom.

props.synopsis: On a Tuesday morning when most kids are at school, a handful of children are waiting to be brought before a judge. This is what a regular week inside the Northern Territory's Youth Justice Court looks like.

title.children: We watched 100 cases in the NT's youth court for a week. Here's what we saw

image.altText: A tall metal structure that has swings attached to via chains that elevates people into the sky, while swinging around.

props.synopsis: A teenager is in serious condition after he was stabbed at the Royal Darwin Show, with the alleged offender charged with recklessly endangering life.

title.children: 15yo boy charged after alleged Darwin Show stabbing of another teenager

image.altText: Missile shoots into the sky in a remote area

props.synopsis:
The Australian Army has test-fired its new Precision Strike Missile for the first time from a remote training base, with the defence industry minister saying the new weapon will be a powerful deterrent to potential adversaries.

Â

title.children: Australia tests new long-range missile capable of hitting targets 500km away

image.altText: A close-up of a G4S logo on a fluorescent yellow vest, with the words: justice prisoner transport.

props.synopsis: Prison staff responsibilities in the NT are set to be privatised further, with Department of Corrections employees told the duties performed by private security firm G4S will be expanded.

title.children: NT expands use of private prison guards to support packed watch houses

image.altText: A mum helping her young daughter use cutlery to eat a meal.

props.synopsis: The community is rallying around the family of a four-year-old girl who was killed by a falling palm tree in Darwin, with more than $94,000 donated so far to help navigate "this time of profound grief".

title.children: Community raises $94k after 4yo killed by falling tree in Darwin backyard

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is considering changing the law in an effort to drive down the costs of coronial inquests. But a lawyer from the Kumanjayi Walker probe says police used far more resources than the community.

title.children: NT government flags capping coronial spends after $8m Walker inquest

image.altText: Two people in defence uniforms, standing near a row of aircraft on a large ship.

props.synopsis: One of the British Royal Navy's two massive aircraft carriers has docked in Darwin, following the testing of missile rearming capability at the city's port.

title.children: Darwin's wartime capability tested as massive UK naval ship visits port

image.altText: Four Indigenous leaders standing outside of Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's four Aboriginal land councils have issued a rare joint statement, accusing the NT government of ignoring the human rights of Aboriginal people.

title.children: 'So disgusting': NT land councils issue warning against territory government

image.altText: A vet in a cowboy hat leans on a metal railing

props.synopsis: For country vets like Dave Morrell, the pressure of long hours and challenging patients can be immense, something the industry is looking to address.

title.children: Dave's vet career began humbly, but long distances and high pressure took a toll

image.altText: A bitumen road with blue water and blue skies in the distance

props.synopsis: Three people will appear in court over the alleged armed robbery of an 18-year-old German tourist in a small fishing village in Queensland's north.

title.children: Three charged over armed robbery of German tourist in Far North Queensland

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I hope you've been hitting the books. We both know you needed it. Let's play, HARD!

title.children: I'm back to test your trivia skills. Have you used your time off wisely?

image.altText: A woman holds a sign that reads "Trump not Welcome" with protesters behind her.

props.synopsis: The US president is in Scotland to play golf at the Trump family courses and to talk trade with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title.children: Scottish protesters take to streets to decry Donald Trump's visit

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: Mr Trump says he warned leaders of both countries that he would not make trade deals with either of them if the border conflict continued.

title.children: Trump says Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire talks after border clashes

image.altText: Lindy Lucena

props.synopsis: Lindy Lucena was beaten to death by her abusive partner. Her family and friends believe she could still be alive today if police had responded with greater urgency â and the police watchdog has concerns too.

title.children: Police took almost an hour to respond to woman's fatal bashing

image.altText: Harry Wilson upset after Wallabies' loss to Lions.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies feel they were victims of an unfair refereeing decision during the dramatic final minute of their 29-26 defeat to the British and Irish Lions in the second Test at the MCG.

title.children: 'We just have to accept it': Wallabies fuming after contentious late call in Lions Test loss

image.altText: Lachie Schultz and Brody Mihocek celebrate a goal

props.synopsis: Collingwood's attempt to arrest a two-game losing streak comes as former captain Scott Pendlebury is sidelined ahead of the clash against Richmond at the MCG. Later, St Kilda tackles Melbourne at Docklands Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Pies flex muscles after Tigers challenge, Saints throttled by Dees in first half

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs are paying tribute to their 1995 premiership side for their match against Manly. Follow live.

title.children: Canterbury honour the spirit of 1995 in clash with Manly

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Match report: Raiders run riot to win ninth straight

image.altText: A press shot of INXS in the '80s adorned with graphic design of Australian flora.

props.synopsis: Scoring film, TV, sporting events and deeply personal moments, INXS's tender ballad has stood the test time. Now, it's been voted as Australia's hottest song of all time.

title.children: How INXS wrote your Hottest Australian song of all time

image.altText: Adam Zampa playing a T20 for Australia in 2024.

props.synopsis: Australia remains unbeaten in the men's T20 series against West Indies after winning the fourth match by three wickets in Saint Kitts and Nevis.

title.children: Aussies post another T20 victory over West Indies

image.altText: Melbourne Vixens celebrate in a huddle after beating NSW Swifts.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Vixens come from behind to defeat the NSW Swifts 66-65 and book a berth against the West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final. Follow live.

title.children: Vixens advance to Super Netball GF after thrilling fightback win over Swifts

image.altText: The arrest warrant pictures all 19 people that are currently wanted.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong authorities have issued arrest warrants for 19 foreign nationals, including Australian and UK citizens, accusing them of national security crimes.Â

title.children: Hong Kong authorities slap bounty on Australian citizen

image.altText: Drone view of cows grazing on a green paddock

props.synopsis: Rain has returned to farming regions in South Australia. But the drought is not over Â â it just looks like it.Â

title.children: Behind blooming paddocks sit communities worn down by 'green drought'

image.altText: A black and white image of a bandicoot head and upper body in a brown frame held in two hands with a book shelf background.

props.synopsis: Hidden in the long-forgotten personal archives of a 20th-century anatomist was a pair of images depicting an extinct species of bandicoot with an unusual butterfly pattern and aggressive streak.Â

title.children: Two precious photos of long-extinct bandicoot found in museum box

image.altText: Three raw lamb chops with fat marbling through them

props.synopsis: An Australian producer develops lamb with a marbling level of at least 7 per cent, with the hope it will one day be treated the same as wagyu beef.Â

title.children: Look out wagyu, lamb wants a spot at the fine dining table

image.altText: Hands of person using joystick to play video game at home

props.synopsis: Across the internet in recent weeks, influencers, streamers and video game fans have been calling for laws to "stop killing games". This is what to know about the movement.Â

title.children: Stop Killing Games movement asks if you can ever 'own' digital content

image.altText: A man in a red hard-hat stands in a field of massive solar panels speaking to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Experts say Beijing's commitment to renewable energy is revolutionising the country's energy usage, and it could impact the fight against global warming and a key Australian industry.

title.children: 'The writing is on the wall': China may have reached peak emissions

image.altText: A sign outside disability support service Bedford.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says it has reached an agreement to secure the short-term future of major disability employment provider Bedford.

title.children: Disability employment provider Bedford avoids administration â for now

image.altText: An ornate double storey homestead with turning circle and gravel driveway and cream fretwork

props.synopsis: A small SA country town hopes a new drama series by global streaming giant Netflix will lead to a boost in tourists.Â

title.children: Small town hopes Netflix series My Brilliant Career will boost tourism

image.altText: Maddison Keeney holds a medal

props.synopsis: Maddison Keeney won her fourth World Championships gold, and first individual title since 2017, in the one-metre springboard, while the irrepressible Rhiannan Iffland claimed a fifth-straight high-dive title.

title.children: Golds for Keeney, Iffland as Aussies make splash in Singapore

image.altText: A truck seen through a gap in road signs.

props.synopsis: Truckloads of help arrive in SA's Eyre Peninsula from across the Nullarbor in WA as part of a huge logistical, cross-border exercise to deliver thousands of bales of desperately needed hay to farms in the grip of drought.Â

title.children: Drought relief truck convoy brings fodder to farms in time-honoured tradition

image.altText: 5 men

props.synopsis: Years of speculation followed the case â but after revived investigations amid reports Hockey Canada used players' registration fees to pay sexual abuse settlements, it was reopened and made public.

title.children: Five Canadian ice hockey players have been acquitted of sexual assault. What happened?

image.altText: a man in a white shirt and blue apron holds tongs and smiles while two teenagers watch on

props.synopsis: Tradies including chefs make a career change to teaching as Victorian schools get creative to fill staff shortages.

title.children: Tradies swap tools for textbooks as they make career change to teaching

image.altText: McLaren's Oscar Piastri driving on a race track.

props.synopsis: McLaren's Lando Norris pipped championship-leading teammate Oscar Piastri to pole position at the Belgian Grand Prix on Saturday.

title.children: Piastri narrowly misses out on pole, finishes second in sprint race

image.altText: Sam Mostyn poses for a selfie with primary school students. They're all smiling.

props.synopsis: Vowing to be a modern, optimistic and visible governor-general, Sam Mostyn has adopted a "culture of care" as a key focus of her term. So how has she done that over her first year in the job? And can she help Australia during these polarised times?Â

title.children: From selfies to service, the governor-general is setting a modern tone
